answers.answer: did you have any other tests besides your TSH?  If ANY thyroid levels come back abnormal there is something wrong! You said you had some MRI's done....Were you by any chance having dizzy spells? Aches, pains, loss of sensation in limbs or tingling sensations? These are all directly related to thyroid problems.  It's good to know ahead of time if the endo you will be seeing specializes in thyroid dysfuntion...many specialize in diabetes.  Your endo may reccomend a biopsy for the growth, or he/she may start with just doing more thorough blood tests.  TSH by itself doesn't tell you a whole lot, you need a FT3 and FT4 done with it to see the big picture, and even sometime TSI and antibodies tests.My advice to you is listen to your body and be your own advocate for your health!Good Luck!
jfellis is right, you need your TSH tested and thyryoid antibodies tested too.  I hope they find out what is going on so you can relax some.  Take Care.

Were you by any chance having dizzy spells? Aches, pains, loss of sensation in limbs or tingling sensations? As well as headaches, muscle spasms, hair loss, memory loss, weakness, confusion, cold all the time (very unnormal, I used to love the winter), etc.Oh my gosh you have no clue, well maybe you do.   About a year and a half ago, I had a near fainting spell come out of no where.  An ambulance was called and my heart rate was 74/35, sever throbbing stabbing pain in my spine area, shaking.  A complete work up was done and nothing was found except my TSH level was abnormal.  My enzymes were normal and chest x-ray was fine, ekg and eeg was normal.  Still to this day are confusing my doctors.  Hope something can be done soon.  Tired of feeling this way.   I have never been sick in my life besides a cold now and then.  Now I stay with a soar throat and colds all the time.

I recently has a biopsy on my thyroid.  My TSH level was just below normal, not enough to worry aboust said the Endocro.  During the biopsy it was very difficult to remove cells because the nodule was very hard.  He doesn't want to do anything now, but I do have to go back in 4 months to check growth.  I just found out my grandmother and one of her daughters had thyrois cancer.  What does this mean to me.  What am I to expect.  The nodule is currently 2.87cm by 1.75cm.  Can anyone tell me what to expect next?  I know everyone is different.  Just don't want any surprises.

question: I have had 2 tests this past year of TSH.  They both have come back abnormal and was told, "Do not worry".  Other things have been going on with me and had to have 2 MRI's done in August of 2007.  I recently had a Myelogram done and they found a growth on my thyroid. Which was not what they were searching for.  However it was found.  I had an ultrasound done this past week and have to go to an Endocrinologist.  What am I to expect?  I am tired of running tests and nothing is done.   HELP!!!  Well now I am worried!
title: Are they ever gonna find out whats wrong?
